conclusion: Analyze the displacement of the bullets and the carts, given their speeds.
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is v0.
The speed of Cart A is v1 (to the left).
The displacement of the bullet in time Δt0 is S1 = v0 Δt0.
Consider the relative motion of Cart A and Cart B.
The relative speed between Cart A (to the left) and Cart B (to the right) is v1 + v2.
The displacement of Cart A relative to Cart B in time Δt0 is S2 = (v1 + v2) Δt0.
The total distance between two bullets in the air is the sum of S1 and S2: s = S1 + S2.
Substitute S1 and S2 to get s = v0 Δt0 + (v1 + v2) Δt0.
Simplify to get s = (v0 + v1 + v2) Δt0.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is given by s = (v0 + v1 + v2) Δt0.
The final answer is derived from combining the displacements of the bullet and the carts, considering their relative speeds.
